field.name: summary
field.value: Unable to create proxy for interface with Square Array paramter

field.name: description
field.value:
Bug surfaces when using Moq to mock an interface with a method that contains a square array parameter.
See this bug report http://code.google.com/p/moq/issues/detail?id=182 Moq owner thinks it's a Dynamic Proxy issue, rather than a Moq one.
<<<<<<<<>>>>>>>>>>> Moq issue copied below for reference. <<<<<<>>>>>>>>>>>>
What steps will reproduce the problem?
trying to mock below interface.
interface IArray { object DoWork(double[,] array); }
//then in test method
var mock = new Mock<IArray>(); var obj = mock.Object
Exception is thrown on above line
"Method 'DoWork' in type 'IArrayProxy424870d0979b484a9e7e44cc389f7ef3' from assembly 'DynamicProxyGenAssembly2, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' does not have an implementation"
There are no issues if a normal or jagged array is used. eg, object DoWork(double[] array); object DoWork(double[][] array);
What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
Moq should be able to mock this interface, but see below exception and stack trace
Test method IArrayTest threw exception: System.TypeLoadException: Method 'DoWork' in type 'IArray424870d0979b484a9e7e44cc389f7ef3' from assembly 'DynamicProxyGenAssembly2, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' does not have an implementation..
System.Reflection.Emit.TypeBuilder._TermCreateClass(Int32 handle, Module module) System.Reflection.Emit.TypeBuilder.CreateTypeNoLock() System.Reflection.Emit.TypeBuilder.CreateType() Castle.DynamicProxy.Generators.Emitters.AbstractTypeEmitter.BuildType() Castle.DynamicProxy.Generators.InterfaceProxyWithTargetGenerator.GenerateCode(Type proxyTargetType, Type[] interfaces, ProxyGenerationOptions options) Castle.DynamicProxy.DefaultProxyBuilder.CreateInterfaceProxyTypeWithoutTarget(Type interfaceToProxy, Type[] additionalInterfacesToProxy, ProxyGenerationOptions options) Castle.DynamicProxy.ProxyGenerator.CreateInterfaceProxyWithoutTarget(Type interfaceToProxy, Type[] additionalInterfacesToProxy, ProxyGenerationOptions options, IInterceptor[] interceptors) b__0() Moq.PexProtector.Invoke(Action action) InitializeInstance() get_Object() IArrayTest.IArrayTest() in C:\Projects\IArrayTest.cs: line 147
What version of the product are you using? On what operating system?
Using VS2008 SP1 on Win XP SP2. Moq 3.1.416.3 Using MSTEST
Please provide any additional information below. This look like a bug to me, unless its by design. I can't see any reason why square arrays as parameters can't be mocked.

comment.author: tedfordgif
comment.text:
Seems to be an issue with google openid login.
I (dmmalam@gmail.com) used https://www.google.com/accounts/o8/id, to login, but it logged in as ted Gifford???
This issue was reported by dmmalam@gmail.com, not Ted Gifford. Could admins change this, and also investigate broken google openid login.

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text:
This is bug in Reflection.Emit. This has been raised on RhinoMocks list some time ago already. See here: http://support.microsoft.com/kb/960240 http://ayende.com/Blog/archive/2007/02/17/Emitting-Multi-Dimentional-Arrays.aspx http://groups.google.com/group/RhinoMocks/browse_thread/thread/d8344b48f214492f
There's nothing we can do I'm afraid, other than asking Microsoft to fix this in the next version of the framework :/ Yeah, this sucks.

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: According to Microsoft this is fixed in .NET 4.0 (see https://connect.microsoft.com/VisualStudio/feedback/ViewFeedback.aspx?FeedbackID=472621)

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: * '''Resolution''' set to ''Won't Fix''. * '''Status''' changed from ''Open'' to ''Resolved''.
